channel.title: Help Me Pick Computer Parts - Video Card
channel.description:
Ok so I bought the first part of my computer now I need help picking out a budget video card. My price range is under $150 and it has to be an ATI card (so I can express crossfire with the integrated Radeon HD 4200).
Current Specs:
ASUS M4A785TD-M EVO AM3 AMD 785G HDMI Micro ATX AMD Motherboard AMD Phenom II X2 555 Black Edition Callisto 3.2GHz Kingston HyperX 2GB 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1800 CORSAIR 650W Modular PSU CM 690 II (Hard drive not choosen) (CD/DVD Drive not choosen)
Do you guys think this will be a decent gaming computer once I add the video card in and possibly unlock a third or fourth core?
[img]http://redakcja.pccentre.pl/d154573r/aktualnosci/19298/Asus_M4A785TD_1.jpg[/img] [img]http://p.gzhls.at/494963.jpg[/img] [img]http://image.skycomp.com.au/products/hx650w.jpg[/img] [img]http://files.myopera.com/utopian1955/albums/941107/Cooler_Master_CM_690_II_01.jpg[/img]

item.title: Help Me Pick Computer Parts - Video Card
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Crossfire only works across two cards of the same series, they can be different models. So you’re severely limiting yourself to old, slow cards.

Read full topic
item.source: Help Me Pick Computer Parts - Video Card

item.title: Help Me Pick Computer Parts - Video Card
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

la­wl:

there are some amazing cheap cases, i got myself a case for $30 and my dad one for $30. mine is complete rubbish, crappy bendy metal and bad airflow, dads is all sturdy and tool-less… just gotta look for the good ones i guess

Yeah I really like the Antec 300 case which I used for a build and I modded it alot, but I dont have 60 dollars for it.

Read full topic
